Parameters: @B_android#content#Context_E@
Context: The parent @B_android#content#Context_E@ that may be used as the parent for this dialog.
@B_android#graphics#Rect_E@

Rect: Specific @B_android#graphics#Rect_E@ that this dialog should be centered around, in screen coordinates. In particular, if the dialog has a "callout" arrow, it will be pointed and centered around this @B_android#graphics#Rect_E@. If you are running at a non-native density, you need to manually adjust using @B_android#util#DisplayMetrics#density_E@ before calling.
@B_android#net#Uri_E@

Uri: A @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Contacts#CONTENT_LOOKUP_URI_E@ style @B_android#net#Uri_E@ that describes a specific contact to feature in this dialog. A work lookup uri is supported here, see @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#CommonDataKinds#Email#ENTERPRISE_CONTENT_LOOKUP_URI_E@ and @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#PhoneLookup#ENTERPRISE_CONTENT_FILTER_URI_E@.
@B_java#lang#String_E@

String: Optional list of @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#DataColumns#MIMETYPE_E@ MIME-types to exclude when showing this dialog. For example, when already viewing the contact details card, this can be used to omit the details entry from the dialog.
@B_java#lang#String_E@

String: This mimetype should be prioritized in the QuickContacts UI. For example, passing the value @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#CommonDataKinds#Phone#CONTENT_ITEM_TYPE_E@ can cause phone numbers to be displayed more prominently in QuickContacts.
showQuickContact(android.content.Context.Description: Trigger a dialog that lists the various methods of interacting with the requested @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Contacts_E@ entry. This may be based on available @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Data_E@ rows under that contact, and may also include social status and presence details.

ClassDesc: Helper methods to display QuickContact dialogs that display all the information belonging to a specific @B_android#provider#ContactsContract#Contacts_E@ entry.
